duas.title: Dua for Waking Up
duas.arabic: الحمد لله الذي أحيانا بعد ما أماتنا وإليه النشور
duas.transliteration: Alhamdu lillahil-ladhi ahyana ba'da ma amatana wa-ilayhin-nushur.
duas.translation: All praise is for Allah who gave us life after having taken it from us and unto Him is the resurrection.

duas.title: Dua Before Sleeping
duas.translation: O Allah, in Your name I die and live.

duas.title: Dua for Entering Home
duas.arabic: بِسْـمِ اللّهِ وَلَجْـنَا، وَبِسْـمِ اللّهِ خَـرَجْنَا، وَعَلَـى رَبِّنَا تَوَكَّـلْنَا
duas.transliteration: Bismillahi walajna, wa bismillahi kharajna, wa ‘ala rabbina tawakkalna.
duas.translation: In the name of Allah, we enter and in the name of Allah, we leave, and upon our Lord we rely.

duas.title: Dua for Leaving Home
duas.arabic: بِسْمِ اللَّهِ تَوَكَّلْتُ عَلَى اللَّهِ وَلَا حَوْلَ وَلَا قُوَّةَ إِلَّا بِاللَّهِ
duas.transliteration: Bismillahi, tawakkaltu 'ala Allah, wa la hawla wa la quwwata illa billah.
duas.translation: In the name of Allah, I place my trust in Allah, and there is no power nor might except with Allah.

duas.title: Dua After Eating
duas.arabic: الْحَمْدُ لِلَّهِ الَّذِي أَطْعَمَنَا وَسَقَانَا وَجَعَلَنَا مِنَ الْمُسْلِمِينَ
duas.transliteration: Alhamdu lillahi allathee at'amana wa saqana wa ja'alana minal muslimeen.
duas.translation: All praise is for Allah who fed us, gave us drink, and made us Muslims.

duas.title: Dua for Entering the Toilet
duas.arabic: اللَّهُـمَّ إِنِّي أَعُـوذُ بِـكَ مِـنَ الْخُـبْثِ وَالْخَبَائِثِ
duas.transliteration: Allahumma inni a'udhu bika minal khubuthi wal khabaa'ith.
duas.translation: O Allah, I take refuge with you from all evil and evil-doers.

duas.title: Dua for Leaving the Toilet
duas.translation: I ask You for Your forgiveness.

duas.title: Dua for Seeking Forgiveness
duas.translation: I seek forgiveness from Allah and repent to Him.

duas.title: Dua for Anxiety and Sadness
duas.arabic: اللَّهُمَّ إِنِّي أَعُوذُ بِكَ مِنَ الهَمِّ وَالحَزَنِ
duas.transliteration: Allahumma inni a'udhu bika minal-hammi wal-hazan.
duas.translation: O Allah, I seek refuge in You from anxiety and sadness.

duas.title: Dua for Visiting the Sick
duas.arabic: لَا بَأْسَ طَهُورٌ إِنْ شَاءَ اللَّهُ
duas.translation: Do not worry, it will be a purification (for you), Allah willing.

duas.title: Dua for Protection from Evil
duas.arabic: أَعُوذُ بِكَلِمَاتِ اللَّهِ التَّامَّاتِ مِنْ شَرِّ مَا خَلَقَ
duas.transliteration: A'udhu bikalimatillahi tammati min sharri ma khalaq.
duas.translation: I seek refuge in the perfect words of Allah from the evil of what He has created.

duas.title: Dua for Parents
duas.translation: My Lord, have mercy on them, as they raised me when I was a child.

duas.title: Dua for Success
duas.translation: O my Lord, increase me in knowledge.

duas.title: Dua for Protection from Hellfire
duas.translation: O Allah, save me from the Hellfire.

duas.title: Dua for Guidance
duas.translation: O Allah, guide us to the Straight Path.

duas.title: Dua for Traveling
duas.arabic: سُبْحَانَ الَّذِي سَخَّرَ لَنَا هَذَا وَمَا كُنَّا لَهُ مُقْرِنِينَ
duas.transliteration: Subhanal-ladhi sakhkhara lana hadha wama kunna lahu muqrinin.
duas.translation: Glory is to Him who subjected this for us, and we could not have otherwise subdued it.

duas.title: Dua for Distress
duas.arabic: لَا إِلٰهَ إِلَّا أَنْتَ سُبْحَانَكَ إِنِّي كُنْتُ مِنَ الظَّالِمِينَ
duas.transliteration: La ilaha illa anta, subhanaka inni kuntu minaz-zalimeen.
duas.translation: There is no deity except You; exalted are You. Indeed, I have been of the wrongdoers.

duas.title: Dua for Strength in Faith
duas.arabic: يَا مُقَلِّبَ الْقُلُوبِ ثَبِّتْ قَلْبِي عَلَى دِينِكَ
duas.transliteration: Ya Muqallibal quloobi thabbit qalbi ‘ala deenik.
duas.translation: O Controller of hearts, make my heart firm in Your religion.

sunnah.title: Using Miswak
sunnah.description: The Prophet (ﷺ) regularly used Miswak to clean his teeth and encouraged others to do the same.

sunnah.title: Sleeping on the Right Side
sunnah.description: The Prophet (ﷺ) used to sleep on his right side while placing his right hand under his cheek.

sunnah.title: Saying Bismillah Before Eating
sunnah.description: The Prophet (ﷺ) said, 'Mention Allah's name before eating. If you forget, say: Bismillaah awwalahu wa aakhirahu.'

sunnah.title: Drinking Water in Three Sips
sunnah.description: The Prophet (ﷺ) drank water in three breaths and advised against drinking in one gulp.

sunnah.title: Entering the Mosque with Right Foot
sunnah.description: The Prophet (ﷺ) would enter the mosque with his right foot and say a dua.

sunnah.title: Leaving the Mosque with Left Foot
sunnah.description: The Prophet (ﷺ) exited the mosque with his left foot while making dua.

sunnah.title: Greeting with Salam
sunnah.description: The Prophet (ﷺ) said, 'Spread salam among you' as it increases love and strengthens bonds.

sunnah.title: Smiling at Others
sunnah.description: The Prophet (ﷺ) said, 'Smiling at your brother is an act of charity.'

sunnah.title: Helping Others
sunnah.description: Helping someone in need, whether by carrying their load or offering support, is a Sunnah act.

sunnah.title: Eating with the Right Hand
sunnah.description: The Prophet (ﷺ) always ate with his right hand and advised others to do the same.

sunnah.title: Covering Mouth When Sneezing
sunnah.description: The Prophet (ﷺ) covered his mouth when sneezing and said 'Alhamdulillah' afterward.

sunnah.title: Using the Right Hand for Good Acts
sunnah.description: The Prophet (ﷺ) preferred using his right hand for good actions like eating, greeting, and giving charity.

sunnah.title: Sleeping in a State of Wudu
sunnah.description: The Prophet (ﷺ) encouraged sleeping in a state of wudu, as it brings protection throughout the night.

sunnah.title: Avoiding Wastage
sunnah.description: The Prophet (ﷺ) discouraged wasting food, water, or any other resources.

sunnah.title: Reciting Ayat-ul-Kursi Before Sleeping
sunnah.description: The Prophet (ﷺ) advised reciting Ayat-ul-Kursi before sleeping for protection throughout the night.

sunnah.title: Saying Alhamdulillah After Sneezing
sunnah.description: When sneezing, the Prophet (ﷺ) said 'Alhamdulillah' and encouraged others to respond with 'YarhamukAllah'.

sunnah.title: Starting from the Right Side
sunnah.description: When wearing shoes, entering a place, or putting on clothes, the Prophet (ﷺ) would start with the right side first.

sunnah.title: Keeping Modesty and Lowering Gaze
sunnah.description: The Prophet (ﷺ) taught that lowering the gaze is a way to protect oneself from evil thoughts and distractions.

sunnah.title: Sleeping After Isha Prayer
sunnah.description: The Prophet (ﷺ) discouraged unnecessary talk after Isha and recommended sleeping early to wake up for Fajr.

sunnah.title: Making Dua for Others
sunnah.description: The Prophet (ﷺ) said, 'When a Muslim prays for his brother in his absence, the angels say: Ameen, and the same for you.'
